ourContent:
Website Design Software

Webster123 is an innovative tool designed to streamline the process of creating static HTML pages. It offers a user-friendly interface that allows users to generate, edit, and maintain web pages with ease. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced web designer, Webster123 provides the necessary features and functionalities to design visually appealing and highly functional websites without the complexity of traditional CMS platforms.

Web Designer Solution

Web pages are often slowed down by SQL databases when displaying static information. Webster123 eliminates this bottleneck by allowing you to create static HTML pages that are lightweight and fast. Combined with modern FTP technology, Webster123 ensures that these pages can be easily uploaded, maintained, and updated, making it an ideal solution for web designers seeking efficiency and speed.

Learn Html

Webster123 offers an excellent platform for learning and mastering HTML. Its straightforward approach allows users to quickly write and view HTML code, providing immediate feedback and results. This hands-on experience helps users understand the fundamentals of web development and improves their coding skills, making the learning process both efficient and enjoyable.

Eliminate your webmaster CMS Headaches

“Webster123 can store multiple websites in one file”

Updating WordPress for simple changes like a phone number can be cumbersome and prone to frequent downtime. If you manage multiple calling card sites, the maintenance can become overwhelming. Webster123 simplifies this process by storing multiple websites in a single spreadsheet-compatible file. This approach eliminates the need for complex CMS systems, reduces server load, and makes site management more straightforward and reliable.

Hit it out of the park with Webster123

Our Inputs and What They Do

Webster123 Variables

This document provides detailed information on the various variables used in the Webster123 program, along with elaborated comments to help understand their purpose and usage.

ourUrl

Commonly known as the slug. It should consist of lowercase words with dashes between them. This is the part of the URL that uniquely identifies the web page.

For example, "web-page-example" can be a valid slug.

ourTitle

The Title of the web page. This is what appears in the browser tab and is important for SEO and usability.

A concise, descriptive title like "About Us - Webster123" works well.

ourContent

The HTML content of the page as provided by the user. This field should contain all the necessary HTML markup to render the main content of the page.

Ensure the HTML is well-structured and valid to avoid rendering issues.

Extra1

Extra HTML content that can be included on the page. This is an optional field for additional HTML snippets.

Use this field for supplementary content such as sidebars or additional sections.

Extra2

Extra HTML content that can be included on the page. Similar to Extra1, this field provides space for more additional HTML content.

Utilize this for any further content that supports the main content.

shareImageUrl

The URL of the share image for the webpage. This image is used when the page is shared on social media platforms.

Ensure the image is of appropriate size and quality for sharing.

siteId

The identifier for the site. This can be used to distinguish between different sites managed by Webster123.

Choose a unique identifier for each site.

ourShareButton

A cell in which an "Add to Any" share button can be added. This facilitates easy sharing of the webpage.

Include this button to increase the page's shareability.

topMenu

The menu of the webpage. Entries are designated by the user to navigate different sections or pages.

Design the menu to enhance user navigation and experience.

ourHeader

HTML for the header of the webpage. This section typically includes the site logo, navigation links, and other important elements.

Keep the header consistent across all pages for better branding.

ourFooter

HTML for the footer of the webpage. This section usually contains contact information, copyright details, and additional links.

Ensure the footer provides useful information and links to key areas of the site.

ourMeta

Meta statement for the webpage. This includes meta tags that provide metadata about the HTML document, such as description, keywords, and author.

Use meta tags to improve SEO and provide better context to search engines.

folderPath

The local folder in which to store the webpage. This defines the directory structure for saving the HTML files.

Organize your folder structure for easy access and maintenance.

Website

The dotcom name of your website, such as yoursite.com. This is the main address of your website.

Choose a memorable and relevant domain name for your site.

websiteUrl

The URL of the website (includes trailing /). Example: https://yoursite.com/. This is the base URL used for constructing links within the site.

Ensure the URL is correct and includes the trailing slash.

styleSheet

The URL of your stylesheet. Relative addressing can be used. This stylesheet controls the visual presentation of the site.

Use a well-structured stylesheet to maintain consistent styling across the site.

Icon

The URL of your icon. Relative addressing can be used. This icon is typically the favicon displayed in the browser tab.

Ensure the icon is appropriately sized and formatted.

fileExtension

The file extension of the pages. Examples are html, htm, asp, php. This defines the format of the generated web pages.

Choose the correct file extension based on your server and requirements.

topHtml

HTML to be added just after the <html> tag of the page. This section can include high-level elements like metadata or external scripts.

Include any global scripts or styles here.

headTag

HTML to be added just after the <head> tag of the page. This can include additional metadata, scripts, or styles specific to the page.

Customize the head tag content for each page as needed.

directoryMode

True or False. The directory mode determines if the page should be saved in a directory with an index.html file or as a standalone HTML file.

Use directory mode for better organization and cleaner URLs.

useLinkBox

True or False. Adds a "Link to this page" block, facilitating easy sharing and linking to the page.

Enable this feature to promote sharing of your content.

frontPage

True or False. Indicates if this is the front page of the website. The front page is usually the main entry point and should be well-optimized.

Welcome to Webster123!

This tool allows you to generate static HTML pages, save them to your local drive so that you can ftp them to your site.

Simple Operation

The toolbar provides quick access to essential functions such as loading a CSV file, saving a CSV file, publishing rows to disk, and viewing HTML pages.

Double Click to Edit

To edit the content of a cell, double-click on the cell you want to edit. A text editor will appear where you can make changes. Click 'Save' to save the changes or 'Cancel' to discard them.

Set It up and Publish

To publish your web pages, enter the row numbers you want to process in the 'Publish Rows to Disk' dialog. Click 'OK' to generate the HTML files and save them to the specified folder.

View the Page You Made"

To view the generated web pages, enter the row numbers you want to open in the 'View Html Pages' dialog. Click 'OK' to open the pages in your default web browser.We'll discuss relative addressing so you can view your pages and images all from your computer before you take it to the net.

File Operations

To load a CSV file, click on the 'Load CSV' button in the toolbar. Select the CSV file containing your web page data and click 'Open'.

To save the current CSV file, click on the 'Save CSV' button in the toolbar. Choose a location to save the file and click 'Save'.

Let's Go

The program loads with a web page in the first row. It is a simple page that shows the only requirements to use this tool to teach yourself html or php. It excels as a "Try this Code Tool". With php, you have to have php installed on your computer but with html you do not.

Basic Requirements To Create a Page

Must Haves

  • ourUrl
  • folderPath (where are we putting it?)
  • fileExtension (html or php)

Now What do you Want To Do?

Like Wordpress and many other content creation methods, We basically provide user space for a Header, a Title, Our Content and a Footer.

  • ourHeader
  • ourTitle
  • ourContent (Our html for the content)
  • Extra1 and Extra2 (Extra Content)
  • ourFooter
Using Webster123 to learn makes html fun.

ourTitle: Trophies Awards and Plaques | Clarksville, Tn
ourContent:
Trophies

A trophy can be a lifetime reminder of the team, the event and the people with whom we shared the moments. It’s a reward for being a part of something. Our trophies are of the highest quality and the years we have spent learning the engraving and mounting of presentation trophies can be your best foot forward in rewarding the team.

Awards and Plaques

A plaque is something we see on successful walls. It recognizes achievements in life as well as sports. Our product will last and is crafted with the finest woods, metals and other woods. Whatever the accomplishment, it can shine like the achievement itself.

Custom Engraving

The engraver is trusted with the surface. A high level of skill is required to “Do it the old way”. That is the way that looks authentic. That authenticity is to be seen and treasured.

“Welcome to Clarksville Trophies, Awards, and Plaques (Clarksville TAPS)!

Before I started this business, I worked for many years with Ronnie Page at Clarksville Sporting Goods. Clarksville Trophies, Awards, and Plaques (Clarksville TAPS) offers you the same personable, quality service you have always relied on with some added options I believe you may find convenient. In addition to well-crafted products, you will now be able access digital options for bill payment plus we offer no-charge local delivery. I can also process purchase orders and accept paper checks if you’d prefer. Whatever your needs for trophies, awards, plaques, and other engraving, please call me at (931) 216-7678 or drop me an email at ClarksvilleTAPS@gmail.com. Should you be in the market for team uniforms, hats, screen printing, or embroidery, please contact Ronnie Page at (931) 801-2234
...... Scott Jackson Owner
ourHeader:
Recognize them with the best in engraving, quality, and presentation.
For awards and trophies
Call Scott Jackson
(931) 216-7678 today.
